sn9.3:4.1: At one time Venerable Kassapagotta was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
sn9.3:4.2: Now at that time Venerable Kassapagotta, having withdrawn for his day’s meditation, tried to advise a tribal hunter.
sn9.3:4.3: Then the deity haunting that forest approached Kassapagotta wanting to stir him up,
sn9.3:5.1: “A tribal hunter wandering the rugged hills
sn9.3:5.3: It’s a waste of time to advise him;
sn9.3:5.4: this mendicant seems to me like an idiot.
sn9.3:6.1: The tribal hunter listens without understanding,
sn9.3:7.1: Even if you lit ten lamps
sn9.3:7.2: and brought them to him, Kassapa,
sn9.3:7.4: for he has no eyes to see.”
sn9.3:8.1: Stirred up by that deity, Venerable Kassapagotta came to his senses.
